snippet: The Institute for Supply Management, a trade group, said that its manufacturing index rose to 53.9; readings above 50 indicate expansion.
abstract: Institute for supply Management says that manufacturing grew in December at the fastest pace in six months, and that hiring at United States factories picked up; results help fuel speculation that the economy was gaining momentum at the end of 2011.
lead_paragraph: The Institute for Supply Management, a trade group, said that its manufacturing index rose to 53.9; readings above 50 indicate expansion.

headline.seo: Manufacturing and Construction Lift Outlook on U.S. Economy
headline.main: Manufacturing and Construction Lift Outlook on U.S. Economy
headline.print_headline: Manufacturing and Construction Lift Outlook on U.S. Economy
